utterances.utterance: Yes, it is.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Ms. Perino, now what is your favorite barbecue food?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, I guess coleslaw.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Is that barbeque?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It is burn at the barbeque.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It is true. Technically.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Is it not?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, but you don't barbecue it, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But you can barbecue corn.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah, there you go.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's a good one. That is a good one. You could also microwave it with a wet towel for a couple of minutes. Quite tasty. Two minutes per ear.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's true. I don't know you knew that. That's a good little tip.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You taught me that.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Somebody has to explain to me how we got -- I'm the third person to answer about barbecue and we haven't talked about meat yet.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: I don't know how that works. I'm going to say ribs and pulled pork, and especially if they're done really well. I'm not good at it. I don't do a lot of home barbecuing. I'm pretty simple, burger, and dogs, and steaks. (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I've got to tell you, it's phenomenal. Even when I order Chinese food I go with the spare ribs. I think it's fantastic, barbeque spare ribs.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: You live more dangerously.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yeah, I'm very dangerous.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Not as dangerous for the pig.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Definitely ribs, well cooked. Crispy, crispy burnt.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Crispy burnt?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: And corn on the cob.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK, so.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I like corn on the cob.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Corn on the cob, everybody loves that. Butter, no butter, I don't know. I'll take it out on the butter. I can't believe it's not butter, our friend?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Ah, Fabio.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Fabio. What's a barbecue without Fabio?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, I wouldn't call it barbecue at all. Not enough Fabio meat there.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yeah. I did answer because I've copied Pete and did the pulled pork thing situation with the ribs. Yum.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Did you date Fabio?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No. He might have set me up with him though.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I did. I tried to set her up with Fabio, but she was involved with somebody else.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And by the way, with what's his name.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I believe it was Yanny.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Or was it Laurel?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's what I said.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right. So what about this? What a weird show. What is your favorite tradition to kick off summer? That's from Sarah.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Probably when we get things out of storage, like Aunt Helen. I don't have any -- I don't think I have any -- I live in an apartment in New York. The only thing you do is you turn on the air-conditioning and hope it works. That's my tradition.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Then you know things look favorable. Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think -- Well, it's not really kicking it off, but I always think of the summer when the dogs are no longer allowed on the beach. Memorial Day to Labor Day the dogs aren't allowed, so you've got to give them their one last big freedom session.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right, Pete.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Yes, since -- I'll go serious for a second since Memorial Day is the kickoff for summer, it's memorializing this day which we talk about barbecues and should have fun, but the first thing you need to do is remember all those men and women that gave everything.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: . so that we can sit at this table today. I know everyone here knows that, but you have to remind yourself. And if you've got kids, sit them down and tell them why this day matter. Why we have this day off. Why we're barbequing. Take them to the parade or take them to the ceremony in your town. It's actually very powerful. So, remember that. It's the guys who gave everything. There's Veterans Day. Today is Memorial Day.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Good point. Good point.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: And July 4th has a great parade in every small town -- in every small town I have ever lived in.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Favorite tradition? We've got to get to the next one.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I like having all the kids who are, at least in the country, comes to Father's Day. I like that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Do you? OK, fantastic.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's a lot of kids for Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Now with the grandkids it's a crowd, burgeoning crowd.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's fun.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: So, my favorite tradition to kick-off summer would obviously be at the hot tub. No question about it, hundred percent. I love it. It just feels like it summer then, happy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Have it for the winter?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It does to me, yes. Because when you get out you're still warm, right? And then you can have little snacks in the hot tub. You should be careful, talk to your doctor about it before you do.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Liquid snacks. Liquid snacks.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It's the same thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's just the table of the people.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes, exactly. I don't have a hamster.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: With Fabio.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yeah, 100 percent, as long as he puts his hair back in a ponytail. It's a grand question from El -- who knows, it's E-L-Z-Z at Roth, something of that nature. What is your favorite vacation location and do you prefer summer, Dana, or winter vacation?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, summer vacations. And where do I go? I like to go everywhere, but I have -- come to have a lot of affection for the Jersey shore.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right. And the bay head. And I also.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: . South Carolina.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Check Instagram.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I do feel like it's summer when I head back west to Wyoming or Colorado, that always feels like summer to me because I spent my youth there.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK, I like that. It's very good. The pictures are beautiful. Check out her Instagram. All right, what about you, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think you know the answer. My favorite place is home. I go nowhere. I don't leave. To me, I can create an entire vacation in my head without having to get on a plane. I hate traveling. So, that's my vacation.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Plus, when he vacations everyone else suffers, because you would think he would come back chipper, happy with a positive sunny disposition, but he comes back cranky.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I thought you liked that Mexico place.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Tulum? I always come back with some kind of illness. The last time I went to Mexico I had a bulls-eye bruise and I had to take four weeks of antibiotic for that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I told you. You have ring worm or something.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah, yeah. I got ring worm from camp, I'll never forget that. No, every time I come back something is wrong with me.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You have different bite.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The world is dangerous.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: . G.I. disorder.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Inside, being inside is the best place. We evolved as human beings to create our own dwellings. We don't have to go outside anymore.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You're a cave dweller.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I am.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Because every day is a vacation day for you then.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm taking off this day right now and you don't even know it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He's idea of vacation is like a bar on Ninth Avenue and a glass peanut, right? And writing your book. I know you so well. Like the newlywed game.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: I like summer vacations in winter. Going to places where is warm during the winter time like Mexico. I like Mexico. Last time I was in Mexico I got a tattoo. So, you go there and you come back like some guy on the corner.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, we've got more than a tattoo.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Very safe place to get a tattoo.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: No, it wasn't. But everything worked out OK.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He got to chase it with some antibiotics.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I've been traveling all my life, you know. The half century I've been on the television news business. And I've seen, basically, the whole globe. Like Erika is so much younger and now old, 12 years old. So, we're re-doing all of the places that I -- like Paris this June.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Sure, that's nice.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: She loves that and visits all the tourist spots, and I drag my sorry behind.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You're like, oh, the Eiffel Tower again.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Actually, having dinner in the Eiffel Tower again.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I hear you're going to take her to Mount Rushmore?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I don't know if I'll take her there. That's really -- that's a motorcycle.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Just knock it all out in one thing, Epcot Center. Go to Epcot Center and you don't have to go anywhere else. You're indoors.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You just became a travel agent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah, Epcot Center. They have all the food around the world, you never have to leave.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK. All right. So, so my favorite vacation -- look, I would have to say is Mexico. I'm no longer allowed there.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Too many engagements. So, I have to find a new one.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They've built a wall.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: they've built a wall to keep me from going over.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK. So, we've got time for one more. Please do a speed round on this, Greg. So, put the pedal to the metal on this. What is your favorite past time when you have some time off? And this is from.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I know the answer.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK. Dana, please go.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: For Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's to skip me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Home.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Home.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Or at the local bar, wine, writing a book.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There you go. That's what I do.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Followed by complaining.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Followed by embarrassing drunken tweets that I have to answer for the next day.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Why?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: why?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Why not?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Please don't do this anymore, sincerely, executives.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Executives, yes. A new band call executive -- the executives. All right, Dana, what is your favorite past time.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I love hanging out with family and friends. My husband, Peter, and our dog, Jasper, but I also -- I really love to read fiction. So, if I get extra -- a little-bit of time to myself I try to do that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You love to go to the beach too with Jasper.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So you read the New York Times.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Fake news.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK. Sweet, Pete?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: I mean, throwing the football around with the kids on the beach, whatever, or the pool. Food, drinks, nothing, you know, sun. Just totally shut it down. Maybe read a book.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Don't go that far.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Boys love to play football and they're quite good. They're quite good. OK. Geraldo?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I love being on the water, as you know.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Just took my boat from New York harbor up the Hudson River. Erie Canal, Lake Erie to Cleveland. So, I went to Cleveland by boat. And I love being on the boat.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right. So favorite past time, I like to read. That's for sure. And then, also, I love to go to the park. The park is very fun.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Which park and what time?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: The park in Brooklyn.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yeah, exactly. We're going to end it right there because it's getting frightening. But we are just getting started, so we want you to stay right there because "The Five" Memorial Day special returns with more of your fantastic questions. That's next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Welcome back to "The Five." We're answering your questions on this memorial fan mail special day, special, special day. And I've got your questions.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Look at the folder. It's blocking your whole body.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Kind of a big folder. OK. Actually, it's just a normal size folder. I am your pint sized host. OK.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Instagram question from "The Five" fan page. Kimberly, what advice do you have for young people who want to do what you do for a living?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Excellent advice, Geraldo?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Look good, feel good. Advised? You know, I love to keep a good calendar, and to do list, and be very focused, like to accomplish something with each day to make every day count. It sounds kind of simple but it's really, really true, because when you have -- the power of just one day, what can you imagine that you can do to change a life or change your route. So, I think that's always kind of like being focused and happy and like getting -- moving the ball forward.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right. Geraldo, you've got some good advice in your book.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: If you want to be on the air, then you should take any opportunity you can to be on the air. Journalism school is nice for theoretical background, but it is the actual hands on experience. Take every internship you can get. Work for the lowest pay at the smallest station if that's the gig that you can get. But get in there and do it because it is doing it rather than reading about it that will be your path to success.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What about you, Pete?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Good advice.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You -- well, almost everyone at the table, except for Geraldo, didn't intend for this to be what we're doing now.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Yeah, I still don't know what I do for a living.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yeah, we've been asking -- that's what we've heard around the building. What does that guy do around here?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: What do we do here?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He wanders from each studio, and then, do you need me, everybody?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Like joining the military is not a bad idea.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: I'll just go out and do things that you believe in, you know. Get involved in something. Go after as hard as can you. Believe in it. Put your head down on it. And don't worry about just doing something so you get to the next spot, to the next spot, no matter what. I mean climbing is important.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Become an expert.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Yeah, become an expert. Have something to say worth listening to. And then you'll -- if it's meant to be it will be meant to be. And you have to be intentional about it. You have to find the places where you can plug in.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, I would obviously say buy my book which is called the Gutfeld Monologue, which the answers is in there, but that would be terrible for me to say.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You shouldn't say that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: OK, I won't. I would say I would agree with Geraldo, if you want to be on air try to be on air. Start by streaking at professional sporting events. And whenever you see a reporter doing a hit on TV, get up behind them and wave your hand and do a lot of gesturing, because the producers go that guy has got something. That's how we actually hire people here at Fox is we watch the people behind the reporters.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That person should be on The Five. That's how we got Hegseth.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: How did they see you behind? I just want to know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I was a writer, so I wasn't going for TV. I was a writer, and so I wrote a lot, and I held a lot of meetings, and that helped me articulate my thoughts.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I would say, also, don't major in journalism. It's not necessary.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, good point.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Take a couple of journalism classes, but major in something -- like Charles Krauthammer would say study history.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah, English, history, absolutely.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK. Instagram question from Susan Mulligan. Peter, I'll go to you first. What do you most look forward to after every show be it food, drink or activity?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Well, a drink, of course.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Even after "Fox & Friends" on a weekend?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Why did you think I told you don't answer.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Yes, I mean, we are a morning show person. By the time the weekend show, which is just four hours long is over, it's basically 5:00 PM on my internal clock.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What do you do, Geraldo?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I like to drink.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I mean that first drink is such a sigh. You know, just, ah, I've done it. But with Fox & Friends, a little different for me because I only go on for 15 minutes, I work out after Fox & Friends.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK. Greg, what do you like to do? Let me guess.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, I like to unwind. So, I'll just have a big giant roll of tape and I just sit there and just unwind it. And for about an hour I find it's incredible stress relief. And then, of course, I do my charity work because children to me matter more than anything on the planet.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Fake news, fake news.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, I would spend the rest of the afternoon just helping out kids.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Random kids.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yeah, random.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Kimberly, how about you?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Think he's a pervert on the playground.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yeah, I'm sorry. I'm traumatized by Greg.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I'm just here to help.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I'm just here to help Johnny.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: My favorite thing to do -- you know, quite, honestly, I like to go -- return calls or messages to make sure I've gotten back to everybody that, you know, means something to me. So, it's nice to do, so they don't think that you've forgotten them.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I like my walk home because it's quite.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I love your sensible shoes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You do walk home.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You take the same path every day, don't you?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, I mix it up.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Nobody notices me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's the great thing about being short is that nobody can -- like, I can glide through a crowd and no one sees me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Like, no eye contact.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No eye contact. I see a lot of unsightly bellies.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK. This question makes me nervous. Instagram question from Mrs. Hammel dot forever. OK. I will start with Greg. What is one of your habits that you know annoys your co-host, but you just can't help yourself?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, geez.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I know. This is a tough question.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yeah, reply all.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: A producer in my ear just said reply all because I often reply all. But it's only just because I don't really mean what I'm saying when I'm replying all.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You do it with all caps.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I do. I'm imitating crazy people, like all caps, reply all.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You're imitating yourself, like, why are we doing this?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I annoy people because I'm constantly complaining about certain - - like things, ailments.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Remember you got the award, number one diva.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah, which is unfair.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Who gave the award out?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right, Kimberly, we're supposed to tell what our own bad habits are. I would say you don't have any, but you have to come up with something.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I love you. Oh. All right. So, sometimes when I get like -- I'm trying to like pipe something -- like, I'm not very good with typing with the tweets, so I'm correcting and fixing it 30 minutes to send one. So, then I check my phone if I'm like nervous during commercial breaks and that might annoy -- that annoys our producer. I'm so sorry.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Pete, I'm sure you don't annoy anybody.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: No, not at all. Don't ask Abby Huntsman or Ed Henry at all.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: No, I'm doing it right now. I pick my fingers under the take. Do you ever notice that?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It doesn't annoy me, no.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: I feel like people could see it or maybe you could even hear it?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, but your mom would not be happy.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: No, I do it all the time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I thought your most annoying trait is when you throw an ax at people.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Sometimes my answers get to be proclamations or monologues, and I sincerely regret.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: How about the vault?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I live my life thinking that everyone is annoyed with me all the time. Even if I haven't seen you in two weeks, I will wake up and think why is Greg mad at me today. I can't remember why he would be mad at me. And I just live my whole life like that. So, do we have time for one more? All right. Question from Jason Ainge, Greg, who preps the most for the show?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think it's without question it's me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It might be.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It might be me. I write -- this is for another show that hasn't happened yet. This is all -- I make so many notes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think it might be you because I think I prep the most for the 2 o'clock show, which means I don't have to prep the most for this show.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah, because everything is working in your brain. The reason why I do this, to go back to an earlier question about what to do to get a job like this, is preparation. Even if you don't use preparation, 90 percent of it is just you acting it out so that it's in your head. So, I write stuff down so it's in my head. So, I call that preparation H.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I knew you were going to say H block.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right, everyone, up next. Which famous American, dead or alive, we want to be married to? Wow. Think about that. "The Five" Memorial Day continues when we return.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: I don't know this one.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's from "Man with the Golden Gun," Pete. It's in the title.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Welcome back. More fan mail questions. Oh, this is a great question. This is from @GoodBreakApril. That's a hell of a nickname. All right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: People can see your --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Must have been a safe driver.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Greg, what's on the outside of your folder? Just FYI.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Notes. What's the weirdest food you've ever had -- Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I am very unadventurous when it comes to food. Oh, gosh. I have to say I don't think I can answer that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Ever tried Jasper's food?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What? No. I don't try -- and I had a chance to travel with President Bush to lots of different places, around the world. It was 44 countries in that last year. There was a lot of things served.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And I was really good at never eating any of it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You stirred it around?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'd fake it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Wow. So no weird foods. You must have had a weird food, Pete.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Yes. Certain things that you just sit around a table with people who don't speak your language and they present it to you. And they're massively offended if you don't eat it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right. Right.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: And no one uses utensils, and so you just sort of dive in.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What was it? You don't know?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: I don't --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Goat?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Goat usually and other assorted meats.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Goat head.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: You get kind of used to it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Brains? Did you eat brains?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Goat head. Goat head soup.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: I actually think -- I don't think I ever had a head. I would say the weirdest thing I would --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: With ganja.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: -- encounter here would be a veggie burger.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I had one of those.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: No MRE?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: That's a bad MRE.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I hope they don't make veggie burgers now with, like, kale. Right?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I bet they do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Geraldo, I'm sure you've had some weird stuff.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Well, in Carnivore, a well-known restaurant in Nairobi, Kenya, they -- they give you the regular meat, the chicken, you know, the beef. And then they get to the giraffe and the alligator tail.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, my gosh.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Or ostrich.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And it goes through every being.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Like a wild kingdom for your intestines.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Like a wild kingdom for your --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You would literally.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Perkins climbing down. We're now in Geraldo's aorta.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It would expire in, like, six minutes, right?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: And the place stinks of, like, flesh. Burning flesh.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Like my apartment. Kimberly, what is the weirdest food you've ever had?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Can I come over? The burnt flesh.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You must have had some weird food on your life. You lived in the Bay Area.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Totally. Accidentally, I'm sure. So yes, when, like, campaigning and everything and then when I was first lady go to a lot of, like, special dinners.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And so you go into different neighborhoods. San Francisco is very culturally diverse. So when you go into some of them it's like different things like floating duck head soup or whatever. Things like that. And you've got to just --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Do it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: -- jump in. Everything is better with a little bit of salt if you're feeling, you know, whatever. But one time I ate my dog's food, because I thought it was beef jerky.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You ate your dog's food?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I was, like, one of those treats.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Not bad, right?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And I was like, "Wow, this is delicious." And then, "Oh, no, that's the -- you know, the dog." I was like, "Whoa, OK." A cookie.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I had the most probably -- I ate the most adorable creature on the planet. If you've never heard of a puffin, Google it and you'll go, "How could you eat a puffin?"

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Why would you do that?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Why would you do that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I was in Reykjavik on vacation. A crazy restaurant that was overpriced, and I said, "Well, if I'm paying this kind of money, I'm eating an adorable animal." And so they served a puffin, and it tasted like licorice shoelaces. It was absolutely terrible. That's why puffins are still around. You taste awful, puffins. That's a great -- by the way, evolutionary trick for animals --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Taste like crap.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- taste like crap.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Right. So then --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No one will eat you.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Wasn't that a scene in a "Star Wars," a puffin being eaten by Chewbacca?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I have no idea.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: No, it was something like that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: By the way, Greg, you know what's something good? You had tripe, like cow intestine. I really love that soup. I grew up having it, you know, being Puerto Rican. And people might think, "Oh, that sounds crazy," but it's quite good.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: It's not bad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Haggis. What do they call it, haggis? Which is a stomach filled with other stuff. Anyway, let's leave that.

utterances.speaker: This is an interesting question from Sean Cantor
utterances.utterance: "What was your favorite radio station growing up?"

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: KRFC.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: KR -- Dr. Don Rose.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Dr. Don Rose, 610 AM. Oh my God. Dr. Donald D. Rose. Used to do novelty songs on San Francisco.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: There you go.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God. Great guy, too. I never met him, but he's dead now.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You could believe it (ph).

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I would say Murray the K. I think it was WINS 1010, before it was all news.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes. Cameraman loving it.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Rock 'n roll.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: 101.3 KDWB in Minneapolis, Minnesota. You know, the kids -- kids, we listened to it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I know Dana's, because you were a D.J.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You were a D.J.? How adorable.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: A country music D.J. That wasn't in my listening area when I was a kid. It was a country music station, I guess. KCCY-FM, 96.9, Pueblo- Colorado Springs.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Now KFRC was AM when I was a kid. But when I was a teenager, all the college stations in California were punk. KFJC, KLAX Berkeley.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Remember K-ROC?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, that's L.A. K-ROC was L.A.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No, but there was one up in the Bay Area.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You think of K-FOG. KFOG.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Are you sure? Was that the rock one?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: KSAN also played a lot of great music. The Bay Area had great -- great --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What about KISS-FM? Where is that from?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: L.A. I don't know. Do I have time?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Yes, I think it is.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I saw the tease.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Did she say "tease"?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think so.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I couldn't hear. All right. I only had two questions. "If you had to name your child or pet, after a president, who would you choose and why?"

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: George.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: George? That was easy.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Theodore, Teddy.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I was going to say Roosevelt. Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Probably Ronald, Ron. I already have Ronan. So --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I would have to say Hillary, because in my heart she won.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: In your heart?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You're with her. You're with her.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm like a cow. I have four stomachs.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You have such a big heart.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I do. I have many small hearts all over my body.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, gosh.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Temporary tattoos, America. All right. Coming up next, if "The Five" could declare one new holiday, what would it be?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I've got a good answer.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Our answers, next. She's already prepping.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Such a great song.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Welcome back. It is a good --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's a terrible song.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: -- to "The Five's fan mail Memorial Day special. It's off the rails, and we'll keep it there. Time to answer more of your questions. My turn. All right. Twitter question from @CaptainMax79. Excellent. "If you could declare a holiday, what would you want to memorialize?" Greg, I'll start with you. A holiday to memorialize, for anything?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It would have to be International Short Man's Day. A lot -- most of the greatest things that have been invented or created since humanity began were done by men 5'7" or lower. Or under.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Napoleon.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Well, he was just one of many. Let's go through the list, shall we?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, no.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, I'll just stop.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Dana, shall we --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I would say Election Day. And I would end early voting.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: That's a great idea.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I would end early voting.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Yes, I agree with that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Election Day. Let everybody have a chance to vote, and there'd be no excuses.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know what, though? There will be people that just won't vote and just take it as a day off. And those people --

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: We'll shame them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- we'll shame them.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Openly. Great answer. Geraldo, try to top that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Hangover Monday after Super Bowl.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Good point.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Jesse Watters agrees with you.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Jesse wants that all the time. Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I mean, good idea.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: You could run for office on that platform.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And get elected twice.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Popular vote and electoral. OK. I would go for -- I have two things. International and Extreme Poverty Day. And also International Children's Day.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's every day.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Everybody thinks about what connects as human beings across the planet.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I'm offended by her choices. Every day should be those days, Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I just fear that --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm sick to my stomach. Four stomachs.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: -- if you had a day for poverty, and everybody was celebrating by not working. It's like Memorial Day. And you don't eat, and you don't memorialize.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No, you spend time with children.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We should have July 5. You know what? Because there's a lot of people who were born on July 5. And it's like, what about me? July 6.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Our country was born the day before that, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know, but you know what? Let's -- let's not forget about those millions of people --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It really deserves two days.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, there's millions of people who were born July 5. They're like, "Hey, what's up?"

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What about me?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: I would decouple Presidents' Day. Lincoln and Washington deserve their own days.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Separate days.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: And they should both be --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: When I was growing up --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Typical. Two white men.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Two white men.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Well, I will not check my privilege.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And then they flash the Puerto Ricans on the screen.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: All right. We're doing well. Next question on Instagram.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: We like holidays.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: DJASC1112. Quickly, I'll go on this one. "If you were a state, which one would you be?" Kimberly, I'm going to start with you. Opposite direction.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I would probably say New York. Since I'm here, I love the diversity of it and also my representations have the best parades here. Irish and Puerto Rican.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Though my principle residence is Ohio now and the secondary residence in New Jersey, I would say New York. I was born and raised here.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Wyoming.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Good.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What was the question? I thought it said, like, if you could be any --

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: If you could be a state.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You guys are just --

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: If you were a state, which state would you be?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I would pick --

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Rhode Island.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Denial.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I would pick Montana.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Montana.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, because you can do a lot of stuff in Montana.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: You can?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. No one knows.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: With the animals?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know what I'm talking about, Montanans. Huh?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That is so gross.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: See you in a few months.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Is it Montanians or Montanans?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I made it up. Could be Montanans. Montanians.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: I would go with New Hampshire. Live free or die.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Very good.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: That is --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Best slogan.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Best motto in the country. All right. Last --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's where you used to campaign first.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: It has nothing to do with politics. Everything to do with guns. All right. Next question is from Facebook, Donna D. has this question. She says, "If you were to get a tattoo --"

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, boy.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: "-- what would it be?" I don't even have to answer that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What don't you have?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: What don't I have? But it's not about me.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: We're going to start flashing? I've got this one right here. See? This was a Jewish star, and I got it after the Maalot Massacre to memorialize the 37 children who were killed by terrorists.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK, that's a really good one.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: That is a good one.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I don't know. I don't have any tattoos like Dana. So body's a temple. I don't know.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Dana has tattoos?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She's covered.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: No?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No. Doesn't have any. Doesn't have any.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Like, the big condor.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: There's a tattoo artist right over there.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I don't know. Maybe like the cross. But a very, very kania (ph) one.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Very sketchy.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: But that was the first one I got, but a nautical kania (ph) one, a big one. Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I hate tattoos on women. Does that make me a chauvinist?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: We'll find out soon enough.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The answer is yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: All right. Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: If I were going to get a tattoo?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: If you had to pick one. Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I know, it's tough. I think it's like --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I just wouldn't.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: -- Jasper.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: OK, Greg. You got time to think.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Herve Villechaize.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: What? Herve what?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He played Tattoo on "Fantasy Island."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He's a hero of mine. "The plane."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: By the way, you two are twinning.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: What about a big podium on your forearm or something? Sorry, sorry. If you had to give up one of the five senses, what would it be?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Ooo.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: The answers next.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Welcome back to "The Five." We are answering your fan mail questions on this Memorial Day. So the firt one is, "If you had to get one of your five senses," Kimberly - -

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: "-- which one would it be?"

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It would be smell, because then I wouldn't have to suffer the Starbucks bathroom situation.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: What about fresh bread, though?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, no, I love all that. I love --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: And the smell of your little baby.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes, well, I love all of that. But you have to pick one.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You have to pick one. You have to pick one.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: It's like deduction, almost. Like, touch no, sight no, hearing no. What's the other one?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Taste.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Taste, no. So it's got to be smell.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Got to be smell.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Get rid of the bad smells, too. In life, you usually experience the bad smells more than the good smells.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You're going to miss some new ones. But --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't know. I think this is a very, very hard question.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It is.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: God gave us the benefit of five senses for a reason. For people who don't have them, it's really tough. And like, if you don't have smell, then you reduce the taste. But I think I would -- I'd go with speech.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Speech?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Is that one of your five senses? I'm not quite sure of that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't know. I just want to shut up.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: We added a sixth sense. All right, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I would say get rid of the census. I hate the census. You know, there are always -- you get those forms. And you go, "I've got to fill it out." Get rid of the census.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm with him.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You, too?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Census. Look at him. He's like blue steel-ing for the camera. Greg.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I think it would be -- and I understand how, you know, people who have lost their hearing really have a real challenge. But at my age I have heard like everything now. I think that I might, you know, I've heard my baby cry. I've heard my wife whisper my name.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. Let's go.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I'm watching. An Instagram question from DevinAdams1004. "If you were ever to join the military, which branch and which job?" Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I would probably join something that keeps me in an office. So it would be probably the United States Interior Office Brigade. And what we do is we just sit there and we talk about stuff that's coming up.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes, you would be, like, super kicked out in five seconds and be complaining.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: And you?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You know, so many that I would like to do. So probably my father was an Army guy, so I love the Army. But then I think, like, being a Navy SEAL would be super fun.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Wow.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Aside from sea sickness.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Great outfits, too.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes. I would shave my head. Wouldn't that be cool?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I'm not sure. Don't try it. Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I would say Marines, and I would like to be deployed as one of the spokespeople that worked with reporters in the field. I thought that -- I think that that would be a great job.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: They had some bad-ass PAOs, the Marines did. No doubt. Major.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: I guess I've done the Army, so I would try something else. And I didn't know anything about the military before I joined, so I defaulted to the Army. I probably would have done -- if I knew more, I probably would have done the Marine Corps the first time around.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Nice.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: And I -- that's going to be heresy to every soldier out there. I don't mean it that way. I loved my time.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Love the Marines. I would fly A-10s for the Air Force or Apache attack helicopters.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What are those mercenaries that are really small?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Best sound in the world.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Small mercenaries?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know what I'm talking about?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: French Foreign Legion?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Gherkins?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: The Gurkhas. The Gurkhas, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Did I just say "gherkins"?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: "One More Question" is next.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH (IMITATING SEBASTIAN GORKA)
utterances.utterance: Gorka.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I like it. Do you love it, Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Favorite summer song.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right. Hope you're enjoying your summer, because it's time now for "One More Question." Indeed. All right. Instagram question from Mark01221: "What is your favorite part about your job at 'The Five' each day?" Or you can say at FOX because many people host other shows, as well. Greg, please?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The money.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Money is good. Money is good.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Good answer. Good answer.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I like that it's so unpredictable. Though this -- "The Five" is not scripted in any way except for what we read at the top. And so you never know what's going to happen. And that's kind of a fun way to come to work every day.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Or how much trouble we're about to get in.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Or how much you might laugh.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's true, which is a lot. Let's be honest. So Pete, you're recession proof. You've got a lot of jobs here.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: I would say the people. I'm going to answer for all the viewers out there. They watch you because they love you guys.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We're like family.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Great personalities. Great --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We're like family to the viewers. I want to make that clear.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Sure.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We are your family.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I don't know about that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Geraldo save everyone.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Well, I like my first tweet of the day. My first cup of coffee and -- first cup -- and to find out where I'm going and what I'm going to be doing.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What about the shop?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We wonder about that, too.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You're so mean. OK. My favorite part. I have to say quite honestly, you guys, working with you. It's the best part of my day besides my munchkin in the morning. It's coming here and, like, looking at you guys and laughing and feeling that sense of family, because I don't have any family but you guys are.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You are one of the nicest people ever.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Sweet. Well, it's fun. Isn't it true, though? It's like nice to care about them. Greg, would you like to redo yours, because it really was subpar.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No. Actually, no. I just look forward to talking. Talking is fun. Getting paid to talk is awesome.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You like your monologue. You like preparing your monologue.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I like chatting.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: You've got to like making people laugh.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Every day is like homeroom.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You know what you like? You like being in the green room and getting your little complain on.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think what you like the most is when, let's say, somebody else is talking and you have an idea or a point that you want to make. and it's like a spark of excitement. I think that's your favorite.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly. It's like I suddenly have to run to the bathroom.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You have that little dark cloud over your head.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Thanks for spending some of your Memorial Day with us. We're going to see you back here tomorrow on "The Five." "Special Report" is next.
